summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganLolaVie Sculpting Paste is a high-performance styling paste that’s giving flexible, touchable hold meets long-lasting frizz control for that effortless model-off-duty texture or the perfect slicked-back look.
details: DetailsBenefitsJen's solution to a decades-old problem: the non-sticky paste she always wished she had on the set of FriendsPerfect tacky texture: versatile styling - everything from sleek updos to lived-in, piece-y texture with a matte finishFlexible hold formula: delivers all-day style without feeling stiff or crunchy72-hour frizz protection*99% naturally derivedFor all hair typesColor safe*lab-tested average result vs. untreated multi-ethnic frizzy hairKey IngredientsPomegranate Sterols: Give you that perfectly imperfect style without the sticky situationHold Complex: Blends B-Pro3™ bond technology, bamboo, birch, and sugar maple saps with kale, carrot, and lemon peptides for piece-y perfectionSuperfruit Complex: A luxe blend of coconut MCTs, amaranthus squalane, and açaí keeps strands hydrated and protected while you serve looksSuper Grains: Chickpea, lentil, and quinoa peptides help seal the cuticle for that signature smooth styleFormulated WithoutSiliconesSulfates (SLS/SLES)ParabensGlutenPhthalatesItem 2625228How To UseStart by dispensing a nickel-sized amount of paste into hands. Activate by warming up the product between palms or fingertips and work through damp or dry hair to texturize and sculpt natural style. STYLIST PRO TIP: Warm between palms before applying for the smoothest distribution. Use a small amount on edges and baby hairs for precise control.IngredientsLactobacillus/Arundinaria Gigantea Ferment Filtrate, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Glycerin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, Cetyl Esters, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, Behenyl Behenate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Lactobacillus, 2,3-Butanediol, Cladonia Rangiferina Extract, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Punica Granatum Sterols, Salvia Hispanica (Chia) Seed Extract, Phyllostachys Bambusoides Extract, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Oil, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Extract, Coconut Alkanes, Polyglyceryl-10 Stearate, Squalane, Acer Saccharum (Sugar Maple) Extract, Bambusa Vulgaris Sap Extract, Betula Alba Leaf Juice, Glyceryl Behenate, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Wax, Parfum (Fragrance)*, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Sodium Stearoyl Lactylate, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Euterpe Oleracea Sterols, Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Extract, Brassica Oleracea Acephala Leaf Extract, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Fruit Extract, Stearalkonium Hectorite, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Chlorella Vulgaris Extract, Olea Europaea (Olive) Leaf Extract, Propylene Carbonate, Lens Esculenta (Lentil) Seed Extract, Hydrolyzed Cicer Seed Extract, Chenopodium Quinoa Seed Extract, Bambusa Vulgaris Extract, Linoleic Acid, Oleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Disodium Phosphate, Sodium Phosphate, Citric Acid, Linalool, Limonene, Citrus Limon Peel Oil, Citrus Aurantium Peel Oil, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia Peel Oil, Juniperus Virginiana Oil, Linalyl Acetate, Pinene, Santalol, Citral *Naturally-derived fragranceShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Start by dispensing a nickel-sized amount of paste into hands. Activate by warming up the product between palms or fingertips and work through damp or dry hair to texturize and sculpt natural style. STYLIST PRO TIP: Warm between palms before applying for the smoothest distribution. Use a small amount on edges and baby hairs for precise control.

reviews.headline: Not for long straight hair
reviews.comments: My hair os about the length of JA in the photos on here and this sculpting paste has made my hair so tangly every time I've tried to use it. I follow the directions, only apply a little, let it set then brush it through and all day my hair tangles so much and is sticky to the touch. I got it with hopes it would tame the flyaways and hold my style when I curl my hair but instead of soft curls they're rough, not shiny, and hard to comb through. I have straight, fine hair so it might work better on thick wavy hair, or the tangles could even be worse. Sad because it actually does help to tame flyaways and frizz but I can't deal with the tangles. For slick back up dos it probably works great.

reviews.headline: I would buy it
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this product! I will not go without it never. It's perfect to slip back bonds.It's just amazing and the hold is amazing!

reviews.headline: Lolavie Sculpting Paste
reviews.comments: I have very fine hair and this does not weigh my hair down. Great dispenser as you don't have to dip your fingers in the product. Good smell too.

reviews.headline: not in a million years
reviews.comments: This stuff is not worth th e money.  Makes your hair sticky and extremely dull.  Do not recommend this product.

reviews.headline: wanted to love this, but...
reviews.comments:
I love the other lolavie products I've used, so I really wanted to love this, but it's not great for fine hair. 
It's so unbelievably sticky that even when styling, my hair wants to stick to my fingers rather than to the rest of my hair, which kind of defeats the purpose. 
I've also used this the way Jen uses it in her promos - by mixing with the lightweight hair oil to tame flyaways - and tbh it doesn't really do anything except make chunks of my hair stick together... but not in a cute way. 
This product might be meant more for thicker hair, but the only thing it really does for me is tame the occasional flyaway in a ponytail, and even then, it doesn't do that job as well as hairspray.
very meh on this one.

reviews.headline: Not my favorite.
reviews.comments: Sticky, don't do what I wanted.  Grief a few times, but felt greasy.

reviews.headline: I will buy this again
reviews.comments: Love it!

reviews.headline: Feels light in hand
reviews.comments: I have thin long hair was hoping it would give texture not wilt hair so a acrunchie hairclip or other would stay in my hair It looks dirty instead Id not recommend it im going to return it waste of money unfortunately

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: Nice product

reviews.headline: no
reviews.comments: this makes my hair "gummy" I was not expecting it to do that.

reviews.headline: Too heavy
reviews.comments: I have wavy medium fine hair. Worn recent layers I thought I'd try this for texture. It was too heavy with just a tiny bit and my hair looked dirty right off. If you have a spouse or son that has short hair and wants a bit is texture,  then pass it on.

reviews.headline: Great Paste
reviews.comments: I have thin, fine hair and this is a perfect paste for me. I love that the scent is very light, that is often a concern with products for me. As with most styling products I recommend using a small amount and you can always add more if needed. Gives great body and definition.

reviews.headline: Unique paste!
reviews.comments: This is a great paste- I am a paste junkie/ have a few favorites and this is becoming one of my top picks. No build up and it's hard for me to use too much. I have shaggy bob and this does wonders for increasing volume in combination with my favorite Davines texture spray!!

reviews.headline: Scent is a downer
reviews.comments: I can't decide if I like the product because.I cannot get past the musty basement scent. It does not dissipate and I smell it all day.

reviews.headline: Perfect!
reviews.comments: I have tried everything to get a bit of texture and hold in my hair without a spray, or a strong fragrance, or silicones, etc.   My hair is long and fine but in great shape thanks to the other Lolavie products.  This paste is amazing but I wouldn't suggest a nickel size to start with as they recommend.  I only rubbed a very small amount between my palms and went straight for the roots on top and sides and lifted and finger combed towards the back.   The volume was exactly what I was looking for and my hair stayed out of my face and in place for the rest of the day!  It's a subtle but perfect finishing step, at least it is for me.

reviews.headline: Absolutely a waste to buy
reviews.comments: I was apprehensive since it was a "paste". Tried it because it advertised as lightweight and flexible hold. Yeah no. Perhaps it works for super thick hair

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: I have fine oily strawberry blonde hair that is short, and this is THE perfect prosuct for me. No oily/waxy residue. Perext finish (for me.) A little goes a very long way. I will be constantly repurchasing this! I sould say this is a medium+ hold. Huzzah!

reviews.headline: Buying this one again
reviews.comments: My hair is thick and coarse and wavy.  I got this as a sample and loved it right away.  It is light and smells great.  I also love that only a tiny amount is needed to tame my waves.

reviews.headline: Bad
reviews.comments: This product made my hair fall out the first time i used it. Do not recommend

reviews.headline: Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.comments: And somebody that doesn't typically like using hair products except a lightweight hairspray, but I've been wanting to try something that wasn't a traditional spray wax or pomade and I've never found a hair paste that worked well enough for my hair whenever I wanted to wear it more curly. I've been a long time user of the manipulator and matte-stermind from Bedhead but I typically only get wavy hair or I end up styling my hair straight with those two products. A little go a long way with this formula, I typically apply half of a pump on damp or dry hair whenever I need to tame freeze and also enhance the curls in my hair. Smells exactly like all the other LOLAVIE products, which is a pleasant Lemon/Keylime scent and doesn't make my hair oily or limp either. I've even used it on a spoolie & brushed it through my brows and flyaways whenever I was in a hurry.

faceoff_positive.comments: I recently ordered the sculpting paste. First of all, I want to say how much I love the scent. It's intoxicating, truly. If you decide to expand your product line, consider adding body wash, body lotion, and a body spray. I would not hesitate to buy these additional products and it's one of the reasons I also ordered the shampoo recently! Secondly, I really enjoyed the benefits of the sculpting paste for two different reasons. I'm 51 and noticed last year I began to have a few unruly white hairs. My hairdresser and I have decided there are not enough of these wiry white hairs to commit to color just yet, but they can create some issues with styling. In addition to this, I noticed that due to my decrease in estrogen due to my age, my hair was thinning a little. I decided to commit to medication to help with may hair growth last fall. I've kept my hair in a stylish bob for the past few years. Since taking the medication, I noted A LOT of new "baby hairs". These also create a problem in styling. The sculpting paste not only resolved these two issues, but help my style to stay in place, even on "bad hair" days. I am a nurse and work long hours. I usually use a round brush and blow dryer for styling, but sometimes give my hair a break and where it naturally, which is a wavy"ish" pattern. The sculpting paste works for both styles. It is easy to use and as I mentioned, smells amazing. I look forward to receiving the shampoo. I received the sculpting paste much quicker than I expected. The packaging was excellent and I feel the price point is reasonable for a high end product, especially since the amount of product required is not too much. I know people are quick to send complaints, but I've always believed good feedback is appreciated as well. I have always loved Jennifer Anniston on TV and in movies, so when she introduced the new product, I was excited to try it. This product lives up to the marketing and I have really enjoyed using it so far. Thanks, Jaime M. Walker, RN
faceoff_positive.headline: Wow! Sculpting Paste and great hair days!

faceoff_negative.comments: First: This made my short, silver hair look fantastic.    Second: It caused an allergic reaction that sent me to the doctor and caused me to spend weeks trying to figure out what was causing it!     I have a tree allergy, especially birch and alder (the most common tree allergies, BTW). After using this the first time, my eyes swelled and I broke out with a rash around them that necessitated a prescription from my dermatologist. I kept thinking "this only happens when I've been in areas where there are a lot of these trees..." and I hadn't been. Guess what, hidden in the multitude of ingredients in this sculpting paste, disguised by Latin species name, these is birch extract, of all freaking things! I completely understand that new products need proprietary formulas to prevent copying and also to protect the celebrities associated with the products from lawsuits claiming they copied a formula, for for the love of all that is beauty, please be cautious with the botanicals!
faceoff_negative.headline: People with tree allergies beware!
